org.apache.distributedlog

Class DistributedLogConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.commons.configuration.event.EventSource
      • org.apache.commons.configuration.AbstractConfiguration
        • org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration
          • org.apache.distributedlog.DistributedLogConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, org.apache.commons.configuration.Configuration

    public class DistributedLogConfiguration
extends org.apache.commons.configuration.CompositeConfiguration
    DistributedLog Configuration.

    DistributedLog configuration is basically a properties based configuration, which extends from Apache commons CompositeConfiguration. All the DL settings are in camel case and prefixed with a meaningful component name. for example, `zkSessionTimeoutSeconds` means SessionTimeoutSeconds for component `zk`.

    BookKeeper Configuration

    BookKeeper client configuration settings could be loaded via DistributedLog configuration. All those settings are prefixed with `bkc.`. For example, bkc.zkTimeout in distributedlog configuration will be applied as `zkTimeout` in bookkeeper client configuration.

    How to load configuration

    The default distributedlog configuration is constructed by instantiated a new instance. This distributedlog configuration will automatically load the settings that specified via SystemConfiguration. 
          DistributedLogConfiguration conf = new DistributedLogConfiguration();
    The recommended way is to load configuration from URL that points to a configuration file (loadConf(URL)). 
          String configFile = "/path/to/distributedlog/conf/file";
      DistributedLogConfiguration conf = new DistributedLogConfiguration();
      conf.loadConf(new File(configFile).toURI().toURL());
    See Also:
    ClientConfiguration

      • getZKRequestRateLimit

        public double getZKRequestRateLimit()
        Get zookeeper access rate limit.

        The rate limiter is basically a guava RateLimiter. It is rate limiting the requests that sent by zookeeper client. If the value is non-positive, the rate limiting is disable. By default it is disable (value = 0).

        Returns:
        zookeeper access rate, by default it is 0.

      • getZKNumRetries

        public int getZKNumRetries()
        Get num of retries per request for zookeeper client.

        Retries only happen on retryable failures like session expired, session moved. for permanent failures, the request will fail immediately. The default value is 3.

        Returns:
        num of retries per request of zookeeper client.

      • getZKRetryBackoffStartMillis

        public int getZKRetryBackoffStartMillis()
        Get the start backoff time of zookeeper operation retries, in milliseconds.

        The retry time will increase in bound exponential way, and become flat after hit max backoff time (getZKRetryBackoffMaxMillis()). The default start backoff time is 5000 milliseconds.

        Returns:
        start backoff time of zookeeper operation retries, in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        getZKRetryBackoffMaxMillis()

        public int getZKRetryBackoffMaxMillis()
        Get the max backoff time of zookeeper operation retries, in milliseconds.

        The retry time will increase in bound exponential way starting from getZKRetryBackoffStartMillis(), and become flat after hit this max backoff time. The default max backoff time is 30000 milliseconds.

        Returns:
        max backoff time of zookeeper operation retries, in milliseconds.

        The retry time will increase in bound exponential way starting from getBKClientZKRetryBackoffStartMillis(), and become flat after hit this max backoff time. The default max backoff time is 30000 milliseconds.

        Returns:

        See Also:

      • getEnsembleSize

        public int getEnsembleSize()
        Get ensemble size of each log segment (ledger) will use. By default it is 3.

        A log segment's data is stored in an ensemble of bookies in a stripping way. Each entry will be added in a write-quorum size of bookies. The add operation will complete once it receives responses from a ack-quorum size of bookies. The stripping is done in a round-robin way in bookkeeper.

        For example, we configure the ensemble-size to 5, write-quorum-size to 3, and ack-quorum-size to 2. The data will be stored in following stripping way. 

         | entry id | bk1 | bk2 | bk3 | bk4 | bk5 |
 |     0    |  x  |  x  |  x  |     |     |
 |     1    |     |  x  |  x  |  x  |     |
 |     2    |     |     |  x  |  x  |  x  |
 |     3    |  x  |     |     |  x  |  x  |
 |     4    |  x  |  x  |     |     |  x  |
 |     5    |  x  |  x  |  x  |     |     |

        We don't recommend stripping within a log segment to increase bandwidth. We'd recommend to strip by `partition` in higher level of distributedlog to increase performance. so typically the ensemble size will set to be the same value as write quorum size.

        Returns:
        ensemble size
        See Also:
        getWriteQuorumSize(), getAckQuorumSize()

      • setEnsembleSize

        public DistributedLogConfiguration setEnsembleSize(int ensembleSize)
        Set ensemble size of each log segment (ledger) will use.
        Parameters:
        ensembleSize - ensemble size.
        Returns:
        distributed log configuration
        See Also:
        getEnsembleSize()

      • getRowAwareEnsemblePlacementEnabled

        public boolean getRowAwareEnsemblePlacementEnabled()
        Get if row aware ensemble placement is enabled.

        If enabled, DNSResolverForRows will be used for dns resolution rather than DNSResolverForRacks, if no other dns resolver set via setEnsemblePlacementDnsResolverClass(Class). By default it is disable.

        Returns:
        true if row aware ensemble placement is enabled, otherwise false.
        See Also:
        getEnsemblePlacementDnsResolverClass()

      • getEnsemblePlacementDnsResolverClass

        public Class<? extends org.apache.bookkeeper.net.DNSToSwitchMapping> getEnsemblePlacementDnsResolverClass()
                                                                                                   throws org.apache.commons.configuration.ConfigurationException
        Get the DNS resolver class for bookkeeper ensemble placement.

        By default, DNSResolverForRacks will be used if getRowAwareEnsemblePlacementEnabled() is disabled and DNSResolverForRows will be used if getRowAwareEnsemblePlacementEnabled() is enabled.

        Returns:
        dns resolver class for bookkeeper ensemble placement.
        Throws:

        getRowAwareEnsemblePlacementEnabled()

      • getNumResourceReleaseThreads

        public int getNumResourceReleaseThreads()
        Get the number of resource release threads used by distributedlog namespace. By default it is 0 - the thread will be created dynamically by a executor service. The executor service is an unbounded pool. Application can use `total_tasks - completed_tasks` on monitoring the number of threads that are used for releasing resources.

        The setting is only applied for v2 implementation.

        Returns:
        number of resource release threads used by distributedlog namespace.

      • getFirstLogSegmentSequenceNumber

        public long getFirstLogSegmentSequenceNumber()
        Get the value at which ledger sequence number should start for streams that are being upgraded and did not have ledger sequence number to start with or for newly created streams. By default, it is 1.

        In most of the cases this value should not be changed. It is useful for backfilling in the case of migrating log segments whose metadata don't have log segment sequence number.

        Returns:

      • getEncodeRegionIDInLogSegmentMetadata

        public boolean getEncodeRegionIDInLogSegmentMetadata()
        Whether encode region id in log segment metadata.

      • getLogSegmentNameVersion

        public int getLogSegmentNameVersion()
        Get log segment name version.

        • version 0: inprogress_(start_txid) | logrecs_(start_txid)_(end_txid)
        • version 1: inprogress_(logsegment_sequence_number) | logrecs_(logsegment_sequence_number)
        By default it is 1.
        Returns:
        log segment name verison.

      • getFailFastOnStreamNotReady

        public boolean getFailFastOnStreamNotReady()
        Whether to fail immediately if the stream is not ready rather than queueing the request.

        If it is enabled, it would fail the write request immediately if the stream isn't ready. Consider turning it on for the use cases that could retry writing to other streams (aka non-strict ordering guarantee). It would result fast failure hence the client would retry immediately.

        Returns:
        true if should fail fast. otherwise, false.

      • setFailFastOnStreamNotReady

        public DistributedLogConfiguration setFailFastOnStreamNotReady(boolean failFastOnStreamNotReady)
        Set the failfast on stream not ready flag.

        failFastOnStreamNotReady - set failfast flag
        Returns:
        dl configuration.
        See Also:
        getFailFastOnStreamNotReady()

      • getOutputBufferSize

        public int getOutputBufferSize()
        Get output buffer size for DL writers, in bytes.

        Large buffer will result in higher compression ratio and it would use the bandwidth more efficiently and improve throughput. Set it to 0 would ask DL writers to transmit the data immediately, which it could achieve low latency.

        The default value is 1KB.

        Returns:
        buffer size in byes.

      • setOutputBufferSize

        public DistributedLogConfiguration setOutputBufferSize(int opBufferSize)
        Set output buffer size for DL writers, in bytes.
        Parameters:
        opBufferSize - output buffer size.
        Returns:
        distributed log configuration
        See Also:
        getOutputBufferSize()

      • getPeriodicFlushFrequencyMilliSeconds

        public int getPeriodicFlushFrequencyMilliSeconds()
        Get Periodic Log Flush Frequency in milliseconds.

        If the setting is set with a positive value, the data in output buffer will be flushed in this provided interval. The default value is 0.

        Returns:
        periodic flush frequency in milliseconds.
        See Also:
        getOutputBufferSize()

        public int getMinDelayBetweenImmediateFlushMs()
        Get minimum delay between immediate flushes in milliseconds.

        This setting only takes effects when getImmediateFlushEnabled() is enabled. It torelants the bursty of traffic when immediate flush is enabled, which prevents sending too many control records to the bookkeeper.

      • getExplicitTruncationByApplication

        public boolean getExplicitTruncationByApplication()
        Is truncation managed explicitly by the application.

        If this is set then time based retention is only a hint to perform deferred cleanup. However we never remove a segment that has not been already marked truncated.

        It is disabled by default.

        Returns:
        whether truncation managed explicitly by the application
        See Also:
        LogSegmentMetadata.TruncationStatus

      • setExplicitTruncationByApplication

        public DistributedLogConfiguration setExplicitTruncationByApplication(boolean enabled)
        Enable/Disable whether truncation is managed explicitly by the application.
        Parameters:
        enabled - flag to enable/disable whether truncation is managed explicitly by the application.
        Returns:
        configuration instance.

      • getLogSegmentRollingIntervalMinutes

        public int getLogSegmentRollingIntervalMinutes()
        Get log segment rolling interval in minutes.

        If the setting is set to a positive value, DL writer will roll log segments based on time. Otherwise, it will roll log segments based on size.

        The default value is 2 hours.

        Returns:
        log segment rolling interval in minutes
        See Also:
        getMaxLogSegmentBytes()

      • setLogSegmentRollingIntervalMinutes

        public DistributedLogConfiguration setLogSegmentRollingIntervalMinutes(int rollingMinutes)
        Set log segment rolling interval in minutes.
        Parameters:
        rollingMinutes - rolling interval in minutes.
        Returns:
        distributed log configuration
        See Also:
        getLogSegmentRollingIntervalMinutes()

      • getMaxLogSegmentBytes

        public long getMaxLogSegmentBytes()
        Get Max LogSegment Size in Bytes.

        This setting only takes effects when time based rolling is disabled. DL writer will roll into a new log segment only after current one reaches this threshold.

        The default value is 256MB.

        Returns:
        max logsegment size in bytes.
        See Also:
        getLogSegmentRollingIntervalMinutes()

      • setMaxLogSegmentBytes

        public DistributedLogConfiguration setMaxLogSegmentBytes(long maxBytes)
        Set Max LogSegment Size in Bytes.
        Parameters:
        maxBytes - max logsegment size in bytes.
        Returns:
        configuration.
        See Also:
        getMaxLogSegmentBytes()

      • getLogSegmentRollingConcurrency

        public int getLogSegmentRollingConcurrency()
        Get log segment rolling concurrency.

        It limits how many writers could roll log segments concurrently. The default value is 1.

        Returns:
        log segment rolling concurrency.
        See Also:
        setLogSegmentRollingConcurrency(int)

      • setLogSegmentRollingConcurrency

        public DistributedLogConfiguration setLogSegmentRollingConcurrency(int concurrency)
        Set log segment rolling concurrency. 0 means disable rolling concurrency. larger than 0 means how many log segment could be rolled at the same time. less than 0 means unlimited concurrency on rolling log segments.
        Parameters:
        concurrency - log segment rolling concurrency.
        Returns:
        distributed log configuration.
        See Also:
        getLogSegmentRollingConcurrency()

      • isWriteLockEnabled

        public boolean isWriteLockEnabled()
        Is lock enabled when opening a writer to write a stream?

        We don't generally require a lock to write a stream to guarantee correctness. The lock is more on tracking ownerships. The built-in fencing mechanism is used guarantee correctness during stream owner failover. It is okay to disable lock if your application knows which nodes have to write which streams.

        Returns:
        true if lock is enabled, otherwise false.

      • setWriteLockEnabled

        public DistributedLogConfiguration setWriteLockEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable lock for opening a writer to write a stream?
        Parameters:
        enabled - flag to enable or disable lock for opening a writer to write a stream.
        Returns:
        distributedlog configuration.

      • getReadAheadNoSuchLedgerExceptionOnReadLACErrorThresholdMillis

        public int getReadAheadNoSuchLedgerExceptionOnReadLACErrorThresholdMillis()
        If readahead keeps receiving BKException.BKNoSuchLedgerExistsException on reading last add confirmed in given period, it would stop polling last add confirmed and re-initialize the ledger handle and retry. The threshold is specified in milliseconds.

        The default value is 10 seconds.

        Returns:
        error threshold in milliseconds, that readahead will reinitialize ledger handle after keeping receiving no such ledger exceptions.

      • setReadAheadNoSuchLedgerExceptionOnReadLACErrorThresholdMillis

        public DistributedLogConfiguration setReadAheadNoSuchLedgerExceptionOnReadLACErrorThresholdMillis(long thresholdMillis)
        Set the error threshold that readahead will reinitialize ledger handle after keeping receiving no such ledger exceptions.
        Parameters:
        thresholdMillis - error threshold in milliseconds, that readahead will reinitialize ledger handle after keeping receiving no such ledger exceptions.
        Returns:
        distributedlog configuration
        See Also:
        getReadAheadNoSuchLedgerExceptionOnReadLACErrorThresholdMillis()

      • getRpsHardWriteLimit

        public int getRpsHardWriteLimit()
        An upper threshold requests per second limit on writes to the distributedlog proxy.
        Returns:
        Requests per second write limit

      • getMaxAcquiredPartitionsPerProxy

        public int getMaxAcquiredPartitionsPerProxy()
        Get the maximum number of partitions of each stream allowed to be acquired per proxy.

        This setting is able to configure per stream. This is the default setting if it is not configured per stream. Default value is -1, which means no limit on the number of partitions could be acquired each stream.

        Returns:
        maximum number of partitions of each stream allowed to be acquired per proxy.

      • setMaxAcquiredPartitionsPerProxy

        public DistributedLogConfiguration setMaxAcquiredPartitionsPerProxy(int numPartitions)
        Set the maximum number of partitions of each stream allowed to be acquired per proxy.
        Parameters:
        numPartitions - number of partitions of each stream allowed to be acquired
        Returns:
        distributedlog configuration
        See Also:
        getMaxAcquiredPartitionsPerProxy()

      • getMaxCachedPartitionsPerProxy

        public int getMaxCachedPartitionsPerProxy()
        Get the maximum number of partitions of each stream allowed to cache per proxy.

        This setting is able to configure per stream. This is the default setting if it is not configured per stream. Default value is -1, which means no limit on the number of partitions could be acquired each stream.

        Returns:
        maximum number of partitions of each stream allowed to be acquired per proxy.

      • setMaxCachedPartitionsPerProxy

        public DistributedLogConfiguration setMaxCachedPartitionsPerProxy(int numPartitions)

        Parameters:
        numPartitions - number of partitions of each stream allowed to cache
        Returns:
        distributedlog configuration
        See Also:
        getMaxAcquiredPartitionsPerProxy()

      • getEIInjectWriteDelay

        public boolean getEIInjectWriteDelay()
        Should we enable write delay injection? If false we won't check other write delay settings.
        Returns:
        true if write delay injection is enabled.

      • getEIInjectedWriteDelayPercent

        public double getEIInjectedWriteDelayPercent()

        Returns:
        dl configuration.
